Exercise III



189
Categorical Propositions
EXISTENTIAL COMMITMENT
It might also seem that an A proposition (with the form “All Sis P”) implies
the corresponding I proposition (with the form “Some Sis P”). This, how-
ever, raises a difficult problem that logicians have not fully settled. Usually
when we make a statement, we are talking about certain specific things. If
someone claims that all whales are mamm
